review.comment_positive:
We were here in winter time (January) and everything was fine: the hotel wasn't too crowded so no noise from others was to be heard. The wind was rattling a bit at the outside from the building in the 7th floor. Yes, the former stunning view is partially blocked now by the new hotel but you can see the sea anyhow. If you want more, you can always check in at the Wink-Hotel and pay the double. Or you go the 400m down to the beach by yourself to have a really good look ;) 
The room was clean and was looked after every day. A hot shower was available day and night, even if the warm water takes a bit of time till it arrives. The elevator worked good and noisiless. The AC worked, only the TV we didn't get started but we didn't bother the staff with that problem. (Maybe they could have helped) 
The staff was very nice, even if they don't speak English, they were very helpful in giving tipps for various places.
The massage they recommended was very good, even if 20.000 dg more expensive than others round the corner, but it was really worth it. The same was for the driver to the airport (that is NOT free as they announce on their website!), but they called a trustworthy driver and even here we paid 80 Cent more than a Grabcar, but the man could drive and knew the way, which is not always what you get. 
All in all I can recommend the Aries hotel, if you are looking for sth. practical. It is nor super romantic nor specifically tasteful, but the location is good, not far from the center, nice coffee shops and restaurants round the corner and not too far from the beach.
review.comment_negative: The hotel is not the most tasteful and most beautiful one, but it is really okay for that price.
